meanings.definition: A skill that is part of a larger skill set.
meanings.sent1: In basketball, dribbling is a crucial subskill of the overall game.
meanings.sent2: Learning to read is an important subskill for academic success.
meanings.sent3: His ability to juggle while riding a unicycle is a unique subskill.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for remembering names is a subskill that sets her apart.
meanings.sent5: Mastering basic math operations is a fundamental subskill for higher-level math.

meanings.definition: To develop a specific skill within a broader skill set.
meanings.sent1: She decided to subskill in painting within her art studies.
meanings.sent2: He is subskilling in coding to enhance his programming abilities.
meanings.sent3: I subskill in baking cookies whenever I need a break from work.
meanings.sent4: They are subskilling in public speaking to boost their confidence.
meanings.sent5: Subskilling in photography has opened up new creative opportunities for her.
